results.title: Contraception: ready or not?
results.brief_description: An internationally acclaimed program for teenagers developed to encourage responsible attitudes towards sex. It is not a comprehensive description of contraception methods but designed to stimulate discussion on issues surrounding contraceptive use. Features a reporter interviewing a sperm, an ovum and a group of teenagers to reveal the myths, misconceptions and truths about contraception. Accompanied by a 10p. Workbook.

results.title: Contraception
results.creator_credit: Granada Television International and Pauline Shaw
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
The most important aspect of family planning is to avoid the unwanted child. Baroness Birk describes to young people the irresponsibility of creating such a child and the damaging psychological, radical and social effects on both the child and the parents. Advice for young people on all types of sexual matters is provided by Family Planning Association Clinics and Brooke Advisory Centre. An animated sequence on the mechanic of conception is included.

results.title: Contraception
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Points out the needs for contraceptives during intercourse. Shows the various kinds of contraceptives used today, covering the history of their development, physical properties, the contraceptive principle behind them and uses live photography to show how they work. Discusses the advantages, disadvantages and comparative effectiveness of each method.

results.title: Continuum
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Sidney Goldsmith, Derek Lamb and Ian Ball
results.brief_description: This film is an excellent introduction to Einstein’s Special Theory of Relativity, one aspect of his General Theory of Relativity. Dr. Banesh Hoffman, a friend, collaborator, and biographer of Einstein, explains the theory’s development. Realistic animation illustrates the principles involved, facilitating their comprehension. Dr. Hoffman’s recollections of Einstein’s personal philosophy of life add a human dimension to an otherwise scientific exposition.

results.title: Continuous observation
results.creator_credit: Basic Films, Leon Clore and Margaret Thomson
results.brief_description: The case-history of a woman patient who has attempted suicide is used to illustrate the techniques of continuous observation. A sequence revealing the patient’s feelings enables the audience to understand them and also to share in the thoughts of the student who is nursing her. Later, in a group analysis, the Sister makes it clear that while text-book rules form a basis on which to work, real psychiatric nursing depends on the use of imagination to gain an insight into the patient’s problems.

results.title: Continents adrift
results.creator_credit: American Educational Films and Lewis C. Hall
results.brief_description: Shows how a scientific hypothesis becomes established in a study of Alfred Wegener’s hypothesis that at one time all the continents were one. Discusses paleomagnetism, sea floor spreading, magnetism in rock and the drifting magnetic poles. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Continental drift: the theory of plate tectonics
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Bert Van Bork
results.brief_description: Outlines the major features of the theory of plate tectonics and notes how the theory can be used to explain the distribution of the world’s major earthquake zones and areas of volcanic activity. Provides ample evidence to support the validity of the theory of plate tectonics and explores some possible explanations as to how the plates actually move. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Continental drift
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Joseph Koenig and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: An exposition through film animation of the theory that Earth’s land areas are fluid and that, in the process of a slow, rolling, boiling motion, one part of the Earth might well be engulfed and then rise again some distance away, much the same as froth on a kettle of soup. From this theory comes the idea that continents were formed from one super-continent that broke up, whose pieces sank, and then rose once more, but far apart. Introducing the film is Professor J. Tuzo Wilson, geophysicist, University of Toronto. Animation by Co Hoedeman. (Award: London.)

results.title: Continental divide
results.creator_credit: Universal Studios, Amblin Entertainment, Bob Larson and Michael Apted
results.brief_description: A romantic comedy starring John Belushi as a Chicago reporter who becomes a Mafia target following his series of articles exposing corruption. Hoping to alleviate the situation, his editor sends him on an assignment to a remote location in the Rocky Mountains to write a feature story on a reclusive researcher (Blair Brown) studying the endangered American bald eagle. Initially reluctant, she lets Belushi stay and despite radical differences their mutual attraction gradually draws them together. Cast also includes: Allen Goorwitz, Carlyn Glynn, Tony Ganios, Val Avery and Bill Henderson. Music composed and conducted by Michael Small. Editing, Dennis Virkler. Cinematography, John Bailey. Script, Lawrence Kasdan.
